Reviews.Title: “great for a budget but reception desk lets it down”
Reviews.Author: estebonbon
Reviews.Content: We recently took a trip to Amsterdam for 3 nights. the botel was perfect because it was cheap and chearful. i always think i dont intend to stay in the accomadation i plan to explore so was perfect for us. Its easy to get to we got a train from the airport to shipol i think its called which for 2 of us cost approx 8 euros. we then walked through the train station and followed the boat sign. to get to the botel you need to take the furthest left dock which has NDSM i think its called. you cant go wrong as its the furthest left one. goes on until i think 1am. its one stop and takes approx 10 mins - you will see the botel soon as you get there its on the left. ferrys are every half hour approx so fairy regular. when geting to the botel the reception was very unfriendly. i had to ask about breakfast and there was no simple smile or welcoming really at all. i get its a budget hotel and i didnt expect amazing things but a smile or a proper welcoming i think goes along way. i didnt feel welcomed. we got to our room. it was small but more than fine - exactly what i expected. the bathroom was very squidged but again was what i expected. when the cleaners did my room wasnt impressed they put my clothes from the bed on to the floor in a pile. not very professional and a bit rude could of folded them or put them back on the bed for me. so wasnt really impressed with that. we then tried to use wifi and that was not accessible without a code which we wasnt given on arrival so we had to go back to reception to ask for it which i think they should ask if you need or want it when you arrive. we then went to ask about bike hire which we ended up doing out of easyness but was 15 euros each which was a little pricey but the bikes were fab - great way to get around. was told if the bike got stolen we would not be responsible long as we had a police report but if they key was stolen or lost we would have to pay. the bikes took us a while to realise no demonstration or advise on the locks etc from the reception staff. not as helpful as they could be. when finished with the bikes we took them back but my back light hadnt worked at all and told them when handed the bike back but she made me feel like i had broken it when i hadnt and didnt say thank you for telling her and made me wait for ages while she did something and then said thank you thats all. very strange and not welcoming or polite again. breakfast... breakfast was fine - bacon was mainly all fat but again it was budget so didnt expect much. had your usual, eggs,toast,bacon,sausage,toast,orange juice, rolls,cheese,tea etc... was absolutely fine for basic. the botel does sway so if you have travel sickness this isnt for you, but it doesnt sway bad you can just feel it slightly. adds to the theme of it being a boat. overall it was fine for what we paid - what was expecting just a shame that the reception and interaction with its staff is really letting it down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but staff ......”
Reviews.Author: mwm91
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my trip to the Botel, in which I spent 4 nights, after arriving on the boat I saw the massive 175 floating hotel, I was excited for this different experience, after entering the boat I was blanked by the receptionist guy, given no welcome but to fill out a card. The room lovely it was a ting cabin but u got to remember your on a boat not a hotel, breakfast was very good both hot n cold buffet. But staff never said hello back or smiled or showed no customer service skills!!! Thanks for my stay Botel, but to the staff cheer up u have a great experience of a Botel! So SMILE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: crandall78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week with a couple of friends, we wanted a cheap weekend break in Amsterdam to visit the art gallery's. I booked it with my Easyjet flight and it was very cheap, Â£300 for 3 including flights from Bristol, so I wasn't expecting much. It's not the place to go for your honeymoon but for me it was great, lots of people around, helpful staff, submarine parked next door, bike hire on site and a pretty good breakfast. The cabin was larger than cross channel ferries and was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Iliveforholidays88
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our topdeck tour. It doesn't look very impressive when you get there. The room was very tiny and very very basic. The bathroom was so small i would imagine tall or large people would find it impossible to move in there! The beds were really hard but it was clean bedding and the room was clean. After sleeping on a boat ... which feels a bit strange because of the rocking, I had a shower which wasnt too bad. The best part of the stay was the breakfast you get a massive selection of food. The food is good quality. The dining room was nice and clean too with plenty of windows to look out. The location of the hotel is strange and we accidently got on the wrong ferry.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ashby de la Zouch, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: gabbyhau
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend staying at the Botel. After reading some reviews here I was only hoping for a clean bed! But, on arrival I was very pleasantly suprised with the small but very clean room, nice comfy bed and as it was -7 degrees outside, a nice hot radiator! The staff were always friendly, rooms cleaned daily, bar sold beer cheaper than we found in the city itself, and the breakfast was perfectly adequate. The free ferry was a huge bonus and we had a really great weekend. Only one minor criticism is that in the evening the music in the bar was a little loud for ordinary conversation at times, and seemed to be from a badly tuned radio station!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: LindaMCoArmagh
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel to celebrate my husbands 50th. We found it to be clean and tidy, with helpfull and friendly staff. The breakfast was good and it was great to take in the nice views of the river ij, while eating and from our room. We found the location good as it is only a 15min free ferry journey from the city. We enjoyed quiet evenings in the hotel and the busy city by day. Amsterdam was a lovely city to explore and we found the people friendly and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: Charley B
Reviews.Content: After reading negative views on here, we were anticipating far worse! We arrived, the reception staff were friendly and helpful. When we wanted to change from a double to a twin, this was changed immediately for us. They remained cheerful and helpful throughout our weekend visit. The room was clean, warm (it was minus 2 when we were there) and provided what you needed. OK it was small, but had an alarm clock and TV - but we were there to explore the city not sit in the room! More than happy with it. The best part however I found was the free ferry from Amsterdam Central, which ran all day and was extremely frequent, even at the weekend. However the bonus point was the night ferry, which you also catch, but this drops you away from the Botel. BUT the Botel has a minibus which will pick you up and take you back you to the door FOR FREE!!! Each time we arrived back (4am and 2.30am) the minibus was there, waiting. It was amazing. Breakfast was good,a helpful yourself affair for a continental breakfast with a good selection of choices. Although busy the staff cleaned the tables quickly so we could sit down. The bar at night was also good, and they have dispensing machines for late night snacks and water. So yes, I really enjoyed my stay here and felt it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Wiltskm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights, it's good for a short stay, it's in a good location, good for money but is definatley more for those who don't plan on spending much time in there hotel. The walls are thin so if your a light sleeper this isn't ideal. Other than that it was a nice stay my only complaint was when they got there someone had left us a present in the loo.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Clean”
Reviews.Author: mashwilliams
Reviews.Content: The Botel is not a high class hotel or a swish guest house. Its basic accomodation for a fantastic price close to Amsterdam. The staff are all very helpful and friendly, the rooms are very small and the shower is tiny but your on a boat so its not going to be monsoon showers and kingsize beds! Our room was warm, we had a small TV with enough channels to entertain and hot water in a very basic but clean shower room. The beds and towels were spotless and the towels were changed daily. If you want a bed for the night thats clean and cosy then this will do you fine. If you want to spend hours in your room enjoying the hotel then book somewhere else. Take pillows if you can as theres are like pancakes and try and book the waterside of the boat so you dont hear everyone coming home late up. The parking is free and you will need to get a ferry over to the main part of town which takes about 10 min. We were really happy with the Botel and would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation”
Reviews.Author: ringdais
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a unique experience. We arrived by train from the airport and found the ferry a little difficult to find as it was not marked very well. When we did find it, we found it to be the best part of staying at this Hotel as it was free every 15 mins. The accomodation was very clean, well laid out and very attentive. The only cost was the internet which was extreme to say the least. We voiced our opinion on this one. The breakfast which was included was great to start the day. Nothing fancy but plenty. Great bar to sit and play cards after a days outing. Bar staff went out of their way to be accomodating to our demands after bar was shut.

Reviews.Title: “interesting accomodation”
Reviews.Author: ipesek
Reviews.Content: i had to find accomodation in high peak season in September, and this hotel was only choice. I've got small but cloan room with miniatur bathroom. Bbecause of windy weather i recognized every swing of botel. This was very interesting accomodation, not far from a center (main train station). Connected by a fare boat, which leaves every 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “clean, cheap, very pleasant great stay”
Reviews.Author: dafydd l
Reviews.Content: free ferry ride to botel where staff were very friendly and helpfull. very basic rooms clean bed sheets everyday and room very clean with a tv and phone in your room.en suite small but clean, rooms cleaned daily. . stayed here twice now and am going back for a 3 stay.. great value for money. bufet breakfast where you could stuff yourself stupid with the selection.

Reviews.Title: “Botel”
Reviews.Author: HollyandNick
Reviews.Content: I have stayed on the botel twice now and would definately stay here again. Ferry ride to the boat free but slightly time consuming, although worth it for the rates comapred to hotels in the centre of Amsterdam. Great breakfast, good shower and warm rooms. Not luxury but you get what you pay for and I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “40 minutes from Amsterdam, poor room, poor service”
Reviews.Author: JJ-2bgluten-free
Reviews.Content: First, this "hotel" is only technically in Amsterdam, it's a longish ferry ride away from downtown, plan on it taking you at least 40 minutes to get to the Dam. Next, the "hotel" is an old converted ship of some type, without the stabilizers you'd find on a cruise ship, which means whenever another ship goes by, the whole thing rocks and rolls - which can really disrupt your sleep or shower. The actual room is tiny, tiny and dumpy. The thin mattress sits on a wooden frame with sharp edges and corners, so when the ship lurches, you hit that edge hard, and I've got the bruises to prove it. The furniture is old, chipped formnica topped built-ins, like a narrow dressing table which has a small TV bolted to it, so there's not room on it to put your suitcase. The one chair in the room was the bent metal kind my elementary school threw out 30 years ago, and it was filthy. We ended up keeping our suitcases under the beds, which isn't exactly convenient. The guy at the desk when we checked in wasn't there for about 10 minutes, and there was no sign on the desk, just a line of folks waiting for Mr. Surly. Our booking specified free internet, he denied that and tried to charge us 6 Euro/$10 per hour. Later, when we went through the lobby to find dinner, Mr. Surly was standing in the doorway with 2 friends, smoking - right by the "No Smoking" sign, of course. You had to walk through a reeking cloud to get out the door. Dinner in that neighborhood? Not a chance, there's no place to go within walking distance, and no info available from the hotel about where to eat short of another long ferry ride back to Amsterdam. There is what seems to be private club, which did not allow outsiders to eat there, near the end of the dock, and then you walk through a strange area of student housing made of shipping containers before getting to a very dark, and rather creepy, neighborhood. Breakfast: the food choices were adequate, but it was hard to find a clean plate or a clean table, and the hot water for tea had a nasty taste of yesterday's coffee. Stay somewhere else and you'll be much happier.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: view_from_the_pier
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights recently with some friends. We had two twin rooms and whilst the accommodation is certainly not luxurious, we thought overall it was pretty good value for money. The rooms are on the smaller side with the bathroom being particularly 'petite' but was fine as long as you are only using the hotel as a base. Would highly recommend earplugs as walls are pretty thin! No hairdryer supplied in the rooms. Breakfast was fine with cereals, toast, eggs, bacon, sausages and tea/coffee which was a surprise as we assumed we would just have a Continental breakfast. No coffee/ tea making facilities in the room which was an issue for the tea addicts in the group. We had a few drinks on the boat in the evening which were reasonably priced but it was difficult to get the attention of and communicate with the barman - struggled to give us correct coinage in change, then when tried to include some coins with a larger note to help this he 'got confused' and had to be prompted to give correct change. Friends staying in the other room requested to be moved as there was no handle on the radiator to control the heating,and room was too cold for them. They were moved to a warmer room within half hour. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. The main issue with the botel is the location. Some (such as us) would view the location as a positive and part of the charm, but if you like to pop back and forward to your hotel throughout the day this would not be the ideal hotel for you. A free ferry runs from central station and are fairly regular, although stop around midnight and replaced by alternate ferry and shuttle bus. The ferry can get busy with bikes and even small engine 'cars' aboard, but there was always enough room to board and only takes about 10mins. Finding the pier initially was not the easiest when we arrived as the only sign we saw was near berth 3 of a completely different canal and we had not realised that we had exited central station by the wrong direction (back entrance to central station across road through repair/building works and its the NDSM berth last ferry dock on left). However we enjoyed the commute to the hotel and the quiet location where the botel was docked. Probably would not recommend this hotel if you want to really party in Amsterdam as the commute would be annoying and impractical. Overall was good value for money and compared to some of the stories I have heard about Amsterdam hotels was actually pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “Something else”
Reviews.Author: flaboes
Reviews.Content: Nice cabins to sleep . breakfast okay , free parking and ferry to Central station . It is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual and decent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Stuart W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights in August, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Checking in was easy, and we found our room to be perfectly adequate. We had a good sized double bed which was comfortable, and the bathroom was fine, small but perfectly ok. The room was cleaned thoroughly everyday, TV was ok, plenty of english channels if needed. We enjoyed the ferry trip from Amsterday, as the ferries are free, quick and regular. Breakfast was great, with plenty, and we just filled up so we did not have to pay the high prices in the city. There was a restaurant bar next to the hotel (Cantine??) and an excellent small kebab shop right next to the ferry berth, with prices at least half of those in Amsterdam. We enjoyed spending time in the small bar on the reception deck, but found wifi and internet charges to be expensive. If we ever went back to Amsterdam we would definitely consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok, cool concept though!”
Reviews.Author: mmac004
Reviews.Content: The boat didnt rock much but when it did I felt it, feels like youve had too much to drink.. so not a good feeling! Must pay for wifi, wasnt worth it to me, I Tried to use the phone once for a long disctance call and phone went dead, lucky for me the receptionist gave me my money back, but still it was an important call! Very small rooms, but was expected as its a boat! Brekfast had bacon which was awesome but didnt like much else.. You need a ferry to go into town which is inconvenient but for me wasnt such a big deal. Hotel was clean though and it really is a pretty neat experience!

Reviews.Title: “not good, not bad - you get what you pay for, may be a little less!”
Reviews.Author: wesleymon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Botel for 1 night @ Â£70 (luckly i booked 1 night only). ' When you pay peanuts - you get monkey business' is true in this case. The receptionist is helpful and friendly. The room was crap, smells mouldy, and we had mosquitoes in bedroom and bathroom for company. I managed to kill about 4 or 5 - which is unaccaptable irrespective of what you pay. The bathroom is very small, kind of flight toilets- and you have to sit bent sideways on toilet as the sink sticks out above toilet. one can hardly fit in the shower cube. the small (12 " or maybe 14" max) black TV in room is ancient and does pick up a few signals -with free porn channel if that is of any intrest. Theere is good connection from central station to botel, with free ferry service. the place is easy to find. ferry takes about 15 mins, then a 3 mins walk to botel. There is no restaurent on botel, just a bar. no restaurents around either, its kind of unused industrial estate+ warf. so you must eat something before catching ferry to botel. next time i would pay bit more extra and stay somewhere decent.

Reviews.Title: “5 days is not enough”
Reviews.Author: giddygecko
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 nights on Botel, what a great trip. The ferry hop from Central station to NDSM werf where Botel is moored is a 12 minute hop. Ferries run really regularly once you get the hang of the timetable, even when you miss the last direct ferry, you catch the ferry from Central station piers to Builksloterweg which is just under 5 minutes ride then Botel's shuttle bus collects you & drives you 15 minutes back to Botel. Breakfast was better than we expected, bacon, boiled eggs, little sausages, beans, cold meats & cheese. Croissants, cornflakes, bread rolls & bread to toast with loads of jams, spreads etc. I still feel like I have "sea-legs" because the weather was a bit choppy/windy/rainy so Botel was rocking but that is just mother nature & cannot be helped.

Reviews.Title: “A crazy hotel for a crazy city!”
Reviews.Author: mrsjessicawilliams
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good but nothing special. It was clean, the beds were comfy and the food was satisfactory. The location isn't great though and you have to get a ferry to get into the centre. I imagine there are much better places you can stay in Amsterdam. We had a laugh here though and it was fitting to stay in such an unusual hotel seen as we were in Amsterdam...a very unusual place! Stay here for something a bit different.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay...Abit of a pain having to catch a ferry back and fourth...”
Reviews.Author: sky l
Reviews.Content: Firstly, you have to catch a ferry over to the Botel. It's the first ferry stand (on the left) They leave every half hour and stop around midnight i think, although we didnt stay out that late! Can be dodgy in the city at night/evening. It's a little bit annoying catching the ferry all the time, alot of walking comes with it! Checking in was great for my boyfriend and i (we were the first amongst 40 odd people arriving also, the lobby is small!) although for a few others there were problems regarding booking reservations, payments. We found our room easily, very standard lay out. The rooms are SMALL! Bathrooms even smaller. Unbelievably small, i flooded the bathroom whilst having a shower, and im small! Excellent few of the city though, and had a cheeky smoke out the window without any problems. (Take some bread back the room for the 2 swans in the water, they love it) The TV is in dutch, no english channels. Radio with popular chart music though. 2 vending machines, drinks and snacks. not much. Breakfast was truly terrible. crap. Finding a cafe or restaurant in amsterdam wasnt much fun either! Big TIP...catch the large ferry not the smaller one. the smaller one takes you to a different stop and you'll have to walk over a mile to the city. And if your planning on visiting coffee shops, take I.D. Beware of the cycle lanes through the city, they are lethal! they cycle so fast! Amsterdam is such a busy place, found the place so confusing. many crowds/gangs of young men around, especially in the evening. overall, the botel is just ok. To be fair the young girl in reception was lovely. oh and the boat rocks too.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable, value for money base to visit Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: McCreery-Morbach
Reviews.Content: The Botel is essentially a floating Travellodge with one exception :- The breakfasts are superb ( unlike travellodge). The rooms are basic but very comfortable and the beds are really comfy. Its so easy to get to. Straight out of central station onto free ferry boats to take you across the harbour to the hotel. It was just like spending a few days moared up in the Mersey or the Thames. Your neighbouring boats are very interesting :- A russian submarine, a 3 masted schooner and one of the Greenpeace ships. We enjoyed going out during the day and having a good look around Amsterdam, coming back on an evening, going to the local restaurant to eat and then having a drink in the evening watching the ships coming back and forth from the North sea. For us it was good to get away from the hustle and bustle of the "amsterdam nightlife" If thats what you want however the botel is easily accessible to the centre and is not overpriced like a lot of the hotels in the centre. The Cantine restaurant nearby is really good and can be thoroughly recommended. We also would recommend the 2-3 day passes for the buses and trams as a way of getting around Amsterdam. Finally the Western docks were very intersting to get a different perspective of Amsterdam if you have the time. A number 10 tram I think.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend and had never been to Amsterdam before. The botel was recommended to us, and after staying there I know why! The staff were helpful, rooms cleaned everyday, nice bar. The only downside some may say is the location it is in now but we didn't find it an issue and actually enjoyed the ferry ride.

Reviews.Title: “ITS CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: hanspan22
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the Botel, the reason we have gone back is simply the fact that it is clean and the location is fantastic, its only a 10 min max ferry journey to the centraal station and the ferrys are always there, when you have a busy day in the city you are far enough away from everything to be able to sleep properly, if only the beds were a bit more comfy. The Bathroom was the smallest room i have ever seen, do not leave you clothes in the bathroom while showering as the whole room gets soaked. Both times we have stayed at the Botel we have requested a double bed and not got one, the hotel have told its best to book direct for this. DO NOT pay for the breakfast its a salad out of a bag thats gone a bit brown, there are plenty of place to eat in the city, the food in the evening is not much better, we were told that the boat done food but both times we have stayed we could only get the kitchen staff to make us ham and cheese toasties, which are very nice but not a meal. what can i can say.... would i recommend?? yes but dont expect too much!

Reviews.Title: “If you plan on drinking, do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: gosensgo8
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend's parent recommended the Botel to us and I have to say we were disappointed. Location: The botel is in a harbour away from the actual city. The only way to access the Botel is by ferry. One positive is the ferries are free but after 1am, they only come every hour. The ferries dock 100 metres from the hotel so in the morning, it's noisy and the swaying is enough to make you sick. Staff: The staff were unfriendly and not accommodating whatsoever. We were interested in seeing real Dutch culture and asked the girl at the front desk for some assistance and she just pointed to the guides on the rack. She spoke perfect English to us the day before but today she was pretending she couldn't understand what were were saying. Rooms: The rooms are super small so if you don't mind being cramped, then it won't be so bad. The bathrooms are super small and when the ferries are coming in, it's hard to keep your balance in the shower. Also, if you plan on drinking....this is NOT the hotel for you. The swaying in the morning is enough to turn that hangover into a pure nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Good points and bad points”
Reviews.Author: kedge
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night stay in Botel in Amsterdam, The good points are The staff were very friendly and efficient, although it looks like they don't employ enough, as there was one person on reception and one in the bar, so if it got busy they were struggling, there was also only one guy doing breakfast. The rooms were very clean, and although small they were cosy. The telly had plenty of English channels including BBC. Also at the the end of our corridor was a vending machine with beer in it, great for a midnight cap. There was also something very relaxing about sleeping on a floating boat. The bar area was lovely, with a little TV lounge area and a pinball machine, the bar was quite reasonably priced and you could get snacks such as burgers or toasties. The bad points are The location was a bit of a pain, it seems fun at first to get a ferry to your hotel but becomes tedious after a while. The bathroom was very small and cramped, and I didn't rate the shower. The amenities were very basic, basically just one soap dispenser. Apart from these two points everything was OK, and I really enjoyed Amsterdam. There is also a bar by where the boat was docked and it was very smart and a decent drink.

Reviews.Title: “wasted holiday, never again”
Reviews.Author: hebeegb
Reviews.Content: Not like the ad says and misleading advertising. in a ` chic part of town what a load of nonsense, its a boat yard. doesn`t say on advertising that you are 10 miles by car from town. New years eve and no ferry to the hotel but 1 10 seat mini bus to another dock out of amsterdam. ruined my new years eve trip and i doubt i`ll ever go to amsterdam again also, its a rip off

Reviews.Title: “I love this Hotel / Boat”
Reviews.Author: TheGlade
Reviews.Content: it is a boat! - very small rooms/cabins, small shower, thin walls - nevertheless I love this place - it's very cheap, so don't expect too much

Reviews.Title: “worst experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: maarten079
Reviews.Content: The one night stay was a total disaster. the pipes of the heating system were ticking constantly. sleeping was almost impossible. We were in Amsterdam and we had some alcohol, otherwise i would have driven home in the middle of the night. My wife complained at the desk and they said that we should not whine about it cause nobody complained before. The rooms are very small, there were holes in the curtain, the ceiling was full with water stains. no I am not so enthusiastic about this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need for a few days in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Kayleigh207
Reviews.Content: I went and stayed on the Botel for my 21st birthday with my boyfriend! all rooms where very clean, Cleaners came round everyday and clean you rooms! staff where friendly and helped out if you needed any! Bathroom was a bit of a squeze as there was not alot of room there! Breackfast severed 7:30 - 10:30, basic breackfast includes toast, sauage, bacon, egg and on a bit off an odd one ham, cheese and salad!! you have to get a boat to and from the hotel from the centre which runs every half hour which takes about 10 mins. you can feel the botel bobs alot of the time whe the ferry goes across (you can even feel it when you lie on your bed too) No Hairdriers in the room so i would take a travel one and also tv has some english chanles

Reviews.Title: “Budget place,lovely staff,clean cabins”
Reviews.Author: jbritishtraveller
Reviews.Content: well folks what can I say,we decided to have a break away.We are on a budget,and this Botel fitted our budget,and we feel so glad we came here.From the moment we entered the boat we were made to feel very welcome.The area where she's moored is a short ferry ride from central station(NDSM werferver)the ride gives you a view of Amsterdam for free.Try this place you never know you may enjoy it as much as we did

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hil68
Reviews.Content: Read a lot of bad reviews after we had booked.... but we were pleasantly surprised! Lovely boat, clean rooms, great breakfast and quiet location. Ferry at back of Central Station every 15 minutes... all enjoyed 5..10 minute journey there and back. Would recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: neeciescotland
Reviews.Content: This was a very enjoyable few days break. The Botel itself I thought was true value for money. We had a double room on the ground floor which was clean enough, yes the bathroom is small but lets face it you dont want to party in it!! good enough for a shower, we experienced minimal smell as some have complained about. Our windows opened right onto the water facing an old submarine and we could watch the ferry going in and out, rooms are booked by land or water view both sides of Botel look onto water just that the other side has the pier wall but still water view so dont go wasting your money adding water view. Breakfast was good enough, Sausages, Bacon(not so good) boiled eggs, bread rolls, continental cold bar, cereals, toast machine, hot and cold drinks machines, preserves and you could eat as much as you wanted. Bar prices were reasonable compared to Amsterdam City prices, no hot meals on offer only snacks Toasties and Cheeseburgers. Check in was quick and easy, we found the staff to be polite enough............even had a night when we had 1 too many and had a go on reception, all taken in good fun by the staff. There is nothing much around the Botel another boat alongside which did meals but was used for a private function while we were there, also what appeared to be a shipyard factory renovation which was a luxurious bar also serving food, no shops around about so make sure you get provisions while coming through train station if required. Brilliant weekend just a pity about the weather wet and cold but did not stop us from being typical tourists, great fun, great place.. Did take a few days of getting home for my balance to settle had the movement thing going on, comes from staying on a boat and ferrying back and forth but well worth it. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location, tatty rooms and unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Alan_L_10
Reviews.Content: I had been told that the Botel was a good cheap place to stay and since we weren't planning on staying in the hotel much I was happy to book a room. However a 30 minute ferry ride, and thats after you've made your way to the station, chipped paint, rust on door frames, coffin sized shower, no tea or coffee making facilities and unfriendly staff made sure i'll never stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel on a boat? The Botel!”
Reviews.Author: Molokov
Reviews.Content: The brilliance of a hotel on a boat called 'Botel' is enough novelty to make this an unique place to stay. The rooms are small (and the bathrooms tiny - sit on the toilet and you've got one arm in the sink and the other in the shower) but it's great to look out of the window onto the water full of swans and ducks.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the city pity about the accommodation”
Reviews.Author: nanseBelfast
Reviews.Content: After a day of travelling was looking forward to getting to a lie down and wash. However we were disappointed on arrival to the botel. The staff were very unfriendly and barely looked at us when checking in. It felt like we were disturbing her. The room was so old and small and very compact bathroom. Thank goodness we spend most of our time sight seeing around the city. Would not recommend it to any one

Reviews.Title: “I'm in Amsterdam 5 to 6 times a year and won't stay any were else!”
Reviews.Author: Bigivanpfj
Reviews.Content: I've been going 2 Amsterdam for the last 10 years. And the botel is cheap as chips. Belive me I've stay in some shit holes but the botel is clean and cheap and friendly. For a lads weekend away botel is good for that. Free boat 2 get u 2 ur hotel and a bus put on after midnight. I will be back on the 18th of sept 2010. I was there for new year eves 2009 it was cold outside but the heating in the room was 100%.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting bathroom, toilet backwash after flushing, no lifts, stairs only”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMay
Reviews.Content: inconveniently located, will need a ferry to utilise, however, it shuts down at midnight, which u then need to catch a shuttle busback to the Botel, which never arrived for us. the bathroom was atrocious, there was toilet backlogged after u flushed it, you will see your neighbour's dinner from the previous night in your toilet bowl. One of the worse places to stay in

Reviews.Title: “I'm still bobbing!”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsNightowl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner for my birthday. Sleeping on a botel was an odd experience to say the least... bob..bob..bob! The staff here were friendly and very helpful on arrival and the free ferry is great and always seamed to come in the nick of time to save us waiting very long. The rooms are very dated and need a facelift. The bed was comfi and clean but the bathroom was very small and dingy and wasn't very clean. Breakfast was basic but everything you needed to start the day, would advise eating during the day as snack menu is very limited.

Reviews.Title: “Different, but very nice”
Reviews.Author: ma_2508
Reviews.Content: The rooms and bathrooms are very small, but comfortable - the matress is excellent, and the heater very effective. The only problems I personally had with the hotel were: 1 - Lack of directions to get there - We came from the airport and arried at the Central Station, and nobody could tell us what was the right ferry to catch. I had to call the hotel, and yet the description wasn't precise. But only this first time was complicated, once you know which ferry it is, the hotel provides you a time table and everything is ok. 2 - Lack of variety on breakfast - There was only one sort of juice (orange), not even a single fruit, and the bread didn't taste very good. Anyway, I got by well enough. Also, there's no reastaurant inside, just a bar, that serves only a very few kinds of sanwiches and chips.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: nywanderer04
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite small and the bathrooms are even tinier... but I guess not completely unexpected for budget traveling in Europe. The Botel is clean and quiet though. While it's very close to the heart of the city, it's far enough away that we got some good rest when we got home after walking around the museums and city all day. I also thought it was convenient to have the train station close by, and the chinese restaurant next door was pretty decent.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: harry_maggi
Reviews.Content: great stay nice and quiet outside of city centre. easy to find from central station and free ferry. small rooms but cleaned everday,plenty of hot water for shower.great breakfast with more than continental choice, plenty of tea and coffee.would not even look for another hotel when we go back to amsterdam. and good rates

Reviews.Title: “great value and close to all amenities”
Reviews.Author: ashlynandjohn
Reviews.Content: when i first saw the boat i was a bit annoyed as it didnt look to great, but as they say you should never judge a book by its cover! the rooms were small but had everything you needed - a bed and a shower! my partner and myself were in amsterdam to be out and about and have a good time. we only needed a place to rest our heads. the staff were extremely helpful and the guy at the bar (an english guy) was very pleasant. the rooms were clean and the same goes for the rest of the boat. there was a slight motion to the boat as it is on a river but other than that it is great. there is a boat service that operates 3 times and hour to the centre of amsterdam. its something different and well worth a try!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the budget traveler.”
Reviews.Author: TimmyJamesB
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here with a tour group for 2 nights only. The hotel literally is a moored boat and does rock a little, so beware if you get sea sick - we were fine though. What I liked about the Botel is that while it is not in the heart of Amsterdam, you can hop on a free ferry just next to Botel (I believe it is free if you are staying there) and it takes only 10 minutes to reach Centraal station. Very easy and convenient. The last ferry back to Botel is at 12am or thereabouts, however you can get a ferry at any hour to a port just across the bay from Centraal station where a shuttle bus will take you back to Botel. I also enjoyed the hotel bar and dining. Breakfast was better than average and served hot food (bacon/sausage) as well as your usual continental stuff. The hotel rooms look a little more like a jail cell than a hotel room. They are small and sterile and the bathrooms are ridiculously small. There are plenty of TV channels including the 'Hustler' channel for all you guys (and girls if you are so inclined). That said, we didn't spend enough time in our room for any of that to worry us. Amsterdam is a great city and there is plenty to do. I would recommend this accommodation to the budget minded traveler who is up for something a little different from your general hotels/hostels.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: perthtravel_junky
Reviews.Content: More like a backpackers than a hotel. Rooms where very small, with very dated furniture made of melamine, which was chipped. Mattress was ok. The bathroom was tiny, when you sat on the toilet you could touch each wall. The bathroom was covered in mould and door frames where rusty. The carpet was old and had holes. The botel moved a bit at night. They did provide a free shuttle from the alternate ferry station back to the botel after midnight until 6am each day, which was a good service.

Reviews.Title: “Really bad, unclean place, horrible staff”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowMoon
Reviews.Content: What we experienced was quite shameful, to put it mildly. First, our room had brown spots on the wall, there was a lot of hair on the matress and even pubic hair in the bathroom. We were then moved to another room, fair enough. This room smelled like cigarettes (we asked for a nonsmoking room) and, finally, one of the towels was covered in brown stains. We left the botel and just paid for the first night. The receptionists were particularly unfriendly and thought we were just a nuisance while we stayed very polite and gentle throughout. One of them had a face full of hatred and told us we weren't welcome to return if we were to be unable to find another place in A'dam. I told her she didn't need to worry about that. It's great to be a Christian, because I've forgiven them, doing myself a favour and not feeling resentful.

Reviews.Title: “sea sick”
Reviews.Author: eddiebirmingham
Reviews.Content: we had been promised it had been concreted in but it hadn't. there was rocking everytime a boat went past. you have to be back before the last ferry, so check ferry timetable before booking

Reviews.Title: “basic but very clean and comfortable room, and staff polite and helpful”
Reviews.Author: skivington
Reviews.Content: Room basic but comfortable and cleaned daily. Pity about location, a bit isolated, but no way threatening, quite safe, busy dockland housing area, one bar/restaurant near by, Botel recently moved to new pier, but regular free ferry shuttle to town, 10 mins. journey close to central station. Longer by road. Breakfast average. Staff helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: Botel
HotelInfo.Address: Oosterdokskade 2-4 1011 Ae ., Amsterdam, The Netherlands
